column4: can anyone recommend an application for traffic shaping ?  Just like cfosspeed for PC..
iproute2
it is the standard tool for QoS in linux these days
http://www.howtoforge.com/voip_qos_traffic_shaping_iproute2_asterisk
there is an example, modify it for your needs
http://lartc.org/wondershaper/
maybe that will suit your needs better.
wondershaper will work then
read the included readme
they all do the same thing really
look into xbindkeys for keyboard macros, i dont know about mouse though
read the readme
do you use dialup?
then you dont "dial in" so that isnt how you use it
it is just a script, edit wshaper and configure the variables to match your internet, make it executable and run it
run it from /etc/rc.local so it starts at boot
you just type the command in rc.local
it just runs like a regular script
just type the command before "exit 0" in rc.local and it will run
as root you can
sudo nano /etc/rc.local
